pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects package¶

Submodules¶

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.BalloonStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.BalloonStyle.BalloonStyle(text: Optional[str] = None, text_color: Optional[int] = None, bg_color: Optional[int] = None, display_mode: Optional[DisplayMode] = None)¶

Bases: SubStyle

A KML ‘BalloonStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#balloonstyle. Specifies how the description balloon of Placemark objects is drawn.

property bg_color: Optional[int]¶

The background color of the balloon.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this object should be included in the build.

property display_mode: Optional[DisplayMode]¶

The balloon display mode.

property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

property text: Optional[str]¶

The text displayed in the balloon. Note that HTML markup, e.g. tables, is permissible.

property text_color: Optional[int]¶

The color of the text in the balloon.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.ColorStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.ColorStyle.ColorStyle(color: Optional[int] = None, color_mode: Optional[ColorMode] = None)¶

Bases: SubStyle, ABC

A KML ‘ColorStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#colorstyle. The ColorStyle is the abstract base class for a subset of the specific sub-styles that are optionally included in Style objects, and that act to apply a color to a Feature.

property color: Optional[int]¶

Color, in 32-bit ABGR format (yes, the order is correct).

property color_mode: Optional[ColorMode]¶

Color mode; either NORMAL or RANDOM.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Container module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Container.ContainedFeature(container, feature)¶

Bases: tuple

container: Container¶

Alias for field number 0

feature: Feature¶

Alias for field number 1

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Container.Container(name: Optional[str] = None, visibility: Optional[bool] = None, is_open: Optional[bool] = None, update_limit: int = 100, style_url: Optional[str] = None, styles: Optional[Iterable[StyleSelector]] = None, features: Optional[Iterable[Feature]] = None)¶

Bases: list[Feature], Feature, ABC

A KML ‘Container’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#container. Note that while Containers are explicitly abstract, Container is the base class for KML Folders and Documents that have an “existence” in GEP, i.e. that are (potentially) user-editable because they appear in the GEP user List View, and that may ‘contain’ other Feature objects, including other Container objects. Note also that Container inherits directly from list[Feature].

append(item: Feature)¶

Append object to the end of the list.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this object should be included in the build.

property children: ObjectChild¶

A generator to retrieve the children of this Object as ObjectChild instances.

Returns:

An ObjectChild named tuple that describes each child as a (parent, child)

construct_kml(with_features: bool = False) → Element¶

Construct this Object’s KML representation and return it as an etree.Element.

property containers: ContainedFeature¶

A generator to retrieve references to the Container objects that are contained or enclosed by this Container object, and the tree that is rooted at it.

Returns:

A ContainedFeature named tuple that describes each container as a (container, feature)

property features: ContainedFeature¶

A generator to retrieve references to the Feature objects that are contained or enclosed by this Container object, and the tree that is rooted at it. Note that Container objects are not yielded by this generator.

Returns:

A ContainedFeature named tuple that describes each feature as a (container, feature)

property flush: Feature¶
force_features_idle()¶
force_idle(cascade: bool = False)¶

Force this Object and all of its children to the IDLE state. This is typically done after the object has been deselected, which will cause it to be deleted from GEP at the next synchronization update. When the Object is deleted by GEP, all of its children will also be automatically deleted. There is no need to emit <Delete> tags for them, and in fact doing so will likely cause GEP to have conniptions.

property is_open: Optional[bool]¶

True if the Container will be initially displayed in an ‘open’ state in the GEP user List View, else False if it will be initially displayed in a ‘closed’ state. None implies the default of False.

property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

remove(_Container__value: Feature) → None¶

Remove first occurrence of value.

Raises ValueError if the value is not present.

select(value: bool, cascade: bool = False)¶

Select or deselect this Object for display in GEP.

Parameters:

  • value – True for selection, False for deselection

  • cascade – True if the selection is to be cascaded to all contained (not child) Objects.

property update_limit: int¶

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Document module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Document.Document(name: Optional[str] = None, visibility: Optional[bool] = None, is_open: Optional[bool] = None, style_url: Optional[str] = None, styles: Optional[Iterable[StyleSelector]] = None, features: Optional[Iterable[Feature]] = None)¶

Bases: Container

A KML ‘Document’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#document. Document inherits from Container and hence Document objects are containers for Feature objects, including other Container instances.

property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Feature module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Feature.Feature(name: Optional[str] = None, description: Optional[str] = None, visibility: Optional[bool] = None, parent: Optional[Feature] = None, style_url: Optional[str] = None, styles: Optional[Iterable[StyleSelector]] = None)¶

Bases: Object, ABC

A KML ‘Feature’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#feature. Note that while Features are explicitly abstract, Feature is the base class for KML Objects that have an “existence” in GEP, i.e. that are (potentially) user-editable because they appear in the GEP user List View.

property container: Optional[Container]¶
Returns:

The Container that contains this Feature in an ownership tree.

property description: Optional[str]¶

The text description for this Feature, that will be displayed in a balloon in GEP if the Feature is clicked.

property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

property name: Optional[str]¶
Returns:

The text that will be displayed for the Feature in GEP.

select(value: bool, cascade: bool = False)¶

Select or deselect this Object for display in GEP.

Parameters:

  • value – True for selection, False for deselection

  • cascade – True if the selection is to be cascaded to all contained (not child) Objects.

property styles: StyleSelector¶

Generator to retrieve the Styles and/or StyleMaps associated with this Feature.

property visibility: Optional[bool]¶
Returns:

True if the Feature will (initially) be checked (visible) in GEP, False otherwise.

Bases: Container

A KML ‘Folder’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#folder. Folder inherits from Container and hence Folder objects are containers for Feature objects, including other Container instances.

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Geometry module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Geometry.Geometry¶

Bases: Object, ABC

A KML ‘Geometry’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#geometry. The Geometry class is the abstract base class for KML Objects that are explicitly geospatial.

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Icon.Icon(href: Optional[str] = None, refresh_mode: Optional[RefreshMode] = None, refresh_interval: Optional[float] = None, gx_params: Optional[GxParams] = None)¶

Bases: Link

A KML ‘Icon’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#icon. Icon objects are used to specify an image file to be used in a GEP overlay. Note that only time-based refresh is currently supported by pyLiveKML.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.LineString module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.LineString.LineString(coordinates: Iterable[GeoCoordinates], altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode] = None, extrude: Optional[bool] = None, tessellate: Optional[bool] = None, gx_altitude_offset: Optional[float] = None, gx_draw_order: Optional[int] = None)¶

Bases: Geometry

A LineString geometry, as per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#linestring. LineString objects define an open sequence of points, or GeoCoordinates such as might make up a track.

property altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode]¶

A AltitudeMode that defines how GEP displays the GeoCoordinate`s that make up the :class:`LineString and treats their altitudes.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this object should be included in the build.

property coordinates: GeoCoordinates¶

Generator to retrieve the list of GeoCoordinates objects that define the LineString.

property extrude: Optional[bool]¶

True if a vertical line (using the current LineStyle) connects each of the LineString’s points to the ground in GEP, False otherwise. None implies False.

property gx_altitude_offset: Optional[float]¶

An offset, in metres, that is applied to the altitude of all the points (GeoCoordinates) that make up the LineString.

property gx_draw_order: Optional[int]¶

An integer that specifies the draw order when multiple LineString objects are drawn in GEP. Lower values are drawn first.

property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

property tessellate: Optional[bool]¶

True if the LineString is to follow the terrain, otherwise False. Note that the ‘altitude_mode’ property must be set to CLAMP_TO_GROUND to enable tessellation.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.LineStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.LineStyle.LineStyle(width: Optional[float] = None, color: Optional[int] = None)¶

Bases: ColorStyle

A KML ‘LineStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#linestyle. Specifies various properties of a Geometry, typically either a LineString or LinearRing, including the inner and outer boundaries of Polygon objects.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this object should be included in the build.

property gx_label_visibility: Optional[bool]¶

Selector to display a text label on a LineString. True if the label is to be displayed, False if it is not. None implies False.

property gx_outer_color: Optional[int]¶

Color of the portion of the line defined by the ‘gx_outer_width’ property. Note that both ‘gx_outer_color’ and ‘gx_outer_width’ apply only to LineString objects.

property gx_outer_width: Optional[float]¶

Width of an outer border around the line. Note that both ‘gx_outer_color’ and ‘gx_outer_width’ apply only to LineString objects

property gx_physical_width: Optional[float]¶

The physical width of the line, in metres.

property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

property width: Optional[float]¶

The width of the line, in pixels.

A AltitudeMode that defines how GEP displays the GeoCoordinate`s that make up the :class:`LinearRing and treats their altitudes.

property gx_altitude_offset: Optional[float]¶

An offset, in metres, that is applied to the altitude of all the points (GeoCoordinates) that make up the LinearRing.

property tessellate: Optional[bool]¶

True if the LinearRing is to follow the terrain, otherwise False. Note that the ‘altitude_mode’ property must be set to CLAMP_TO_GROUND to enable tessellation.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Link module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Link.Link(href: Optional[str] = None, refresh_mode: Optional[RefreshMode] = None, refresh_interval: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: Object

A KML ‘Link’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#link. Link objects are used to specify a KML file to be fetched with a NetworkLink; or an image file to be used in a GEP overlay, using the Icon class that inherits from Link. The KML specification also uses Link objects to specify the location of Models, but Models are not currently implemented in pyLiveKML. Note also that only time-based refresh is currently supported by pyLiveKML.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this object should be included in the build.

property href: Optional[str]¶

A URI that specifies the location of the file that is linked to.

property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

property refresh_interval: Optional[float]¶

The refresh interval, in seconds, that will be used if the ‘refresh_mode’ property is set to ON_INTERVAL.

property refresh_mode: Optional[RefreshMode]¶

The refresh mode that controls when the file specified by the ‘href’ property is retrieved.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.NetworkLink module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.NetworkLink.NetworkLink(name: Optional[str] = None, href: Optional[str] = None, refresh_mode: Optional[RefreshMode] = None, refresh_interval: Optional[float] = None, is_open: Optional[bool] = None)¶

Bases: Feature

A KML ‘NetworkLink’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#networklink. NetworkLink objects are typically used to direct GEP to periodically retrieve a file from a specified href.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this object should be included in the build.

property children: ObjectChild¶

A generator to retrieve the children of this Object as ObjectChild instances.

Returns:

An ObjectChild named tuple that describes each child as a (parent, child)

property fly_to_view: Optional[bool]¶

True if this NetworkLink instructs GEP to fly to its view location when loaded, else False if it does not. None implies the default of False.

property is_open: Optional[bool]¶

True if the NetworkLink will be initially displayed in an ‘open’ state in the GEP user List View, else False if it will be initially displayed in a ‘closed’ state. None implies the default of False.

property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

property link: Link¶

The child Link object that identifies how and from where this NetworkLink will load its dependent file.

property refresh_visibility: Optional[bool]¶

True if the GEP user is not permitted to control the visibility of the NetworkLink or its children, else False if the GEP user has full control over that visibility. None implies the default of False.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Object module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Object.Object¶

Bases: ABC

A KML ‘Object’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#object. Note that Objects are explicitly abstract, and are the base class from which most other KML elements (anything with an ‘id’ property) derive.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children: bool = True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this object should be included in the build.

change_kml(update: Element)¶

Construct a complete <Change> element tree as a child of an <Update> tag.

Param:

update: The etree.Element of the <Update> tag.

property children: ObjectChild¶

A generator to retrieve the children of this Object as ObjectChild instances.

Returns:

An ObjectChild named tuple that describes each child as a (parent, child)

construct_kml() → Element¶

Construct this Object’s KML representation and return it as an etree.Element.

create_kml(parent: Object, update: Element) → Element¶

Construct a complete <Create> element tree as a child of an <Update> tag.

Param:

parent: The immediate parent Object of this Object. The parent must be specified for GEP synchronization.

Param:

update: The etree.Element of the <Update> tag.

delete_kml(update: Element)¶

Construct a complete <Delete> element tree as a child of an <Update> tag.

Param:

update: The etree.Element of the <Update> tag.

field_changed()¶

Flag that a field or property of this Object has changed, and re-synchronization with GEP may be required.

force_idle()¶

Force this Object and all of its children to the IDLE state. This is typically done after the object has been deselected, which will cause it to be deleted from GEP at the next synchronization update. When the Object is deleted by GEP, all of its children will also be automatically deleted. There is no need to emit <Delete> tags for them, and in fact doing so will likely cause GEP to have conniptions.

property id: uuid4¶
Returns:

The unique identifier of the Object as a uuid4.

abstract property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

select(value: bool, cascade: bool = False)¶

Select or deselect this Object for display in GEP.

Parameters:

  • value – True for selection, False for deselection

  • cascade – True if the selection is to be cascaded to all contained (not child) Objects.

property selected: bool¶
Returns:

True if this Object has been created and is not scheduled for deletion; otherwise False.

property state: State¶
Returns:

The current GEP synchronization state of this Object.

update_generated()¶

Modify the state of the object to reflect that a synchronization update has been emitted.

update_kml(parent: Object, update: Element)¶

Retrieve a complete child <Create>, <Change> or <Delete> element tree as a child of an <Update> tag. The type of child is dependent on the current state of this Object.

Parameters:

  • parent – The immediate parent Object of this Object. The parent is required only for <Create> tags.

  • update – The etree.Element of the <Update> tag.

Bases: Geometry

A Point geometry, as per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#point. Point objects define a simple geographic location, described a longitude, latitude and optional altitude.

A AltitudeMode that defines how GEP displays the Point and treats its’ altitude.

A GeoCoordinates object that defines the longitude, latitude and optional altitude of the Point.

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.PolyStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.PolyStyle.PolyStyle(color: Optional[int] = None, color_mode: Optional[ColorMode] = None, fill: Optional[bool] = None, outline: Optional[bool] = None)¶

Bases: ColorStyle

A KML ‘PolyStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#polystyle. Specifies various properties that define how a Polygon is drawn.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this object should be included in the build.

property fill: bool¶

True if the Polygon is to be filled in using the ‘color’ property. False if it is not. None implies True.

property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

property outline: bool¶

True if the outline of the Polygon is to be drawn using a separate LineStyle. False if it is not. None implies True.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Polygon module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Polygon.Polygon(outer_boundary: LinearRing, inner_boundaries: Optional[Iterable[LinearRing]] = None, altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode] = None, extrude: Optional[bool] = None, tessellate: Optional[bool] = None)¶

Bases: Geometry

A Polygon geometry, as per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#polygon. Polygon objects are made up of an outer boundary that is a LinearRing and any number of inner boundaries, each of which is also a LinearRing.

property altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode]¶

A AltitudeMode that defines how GEP displays the GeoCoordinate`s that make up the :class:`Polygon’s inner and outer boundaries, and treats their altitudes.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this object should be included in the build.

property extrude: Optional[bool]¶

True if a vertical line (using the current LineStyle) connects each of the Polygon’s points (from both inner and outer boundaries) to the ground in GEP, False otherwise. None implies False.

property inner_boundaries: LinearRing¶

Generator to retrieve the LinearRing objects that define cutouts within the outer boundary.

property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

property outer_boundary: LinearRing¶

The LinearRing that defines the outer extents of the Polygon.

property tessellate: Optional[bool]¶

True if the Polygon is to follow the terrain, otherwise False. Note that the ‘altitude_mode’ property must be set to CLAMP_TO_GROUND to enable tessellation.

update_kml(parent: Object, update: Element)¶

Retrieve a complete child <Create>, <Change> or <Delete> element tree as a child of an <Update> tag. The type of child is dependent on the current state of this Object.

Parameters:

  • parent – The immediate parent Object of this Object. The parent is required only for <Create> tags.

  • update – The etree.Element of the <Update> tag.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.StyleMap module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.StyleMap.StyleMap(normal_style_url: Optional[str] = None, normal_style: Optional[Style] = None, highlight_style_url: Optional[str] = None, highlight_style: Optional[Style] = None)¶

Bases: StyleSelector

A KML ‘StyleMap’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#stylemap. Maps between two different Style objects for the ‘normal’ and ‘highlighted’ states of a Feature. The styles may be referenced by URI, or in-line in the StyleMap. Note that it is both possible and reasonable to assign both a styleUrl and a Style to either or both of the normal and highlight options. Per the rules discussed at https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#feature, the inline Style will override the referenced (URL) style.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this object should be included in the build.

property children: ObjectChild¶

A generator to retrieve the children of this Object as ObjectChild instances.

Returns:

An ObjectChild named tuple that describes each child as a (parent, child)

property highlight_style: Optional[Style]¶

An inline Style object that will be employed when the target Feature is displayed in ‘highlight’ mode.

property highlight_style_url: Optional[str]¶

A URI that references the Style that will be employed when the target Feature is displayed in ‘highlight’ mode.

property kml_type: str¶
Returns:

The name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

property normal_style: Optional[Style]¶

An inline Style object that will be employed when the target Feature is displayed in ‘normal’ mode.

property normal_style_url: Optional[str]¶

A URI that references the Style that will be employed when the target Feature is displayed in ‘normal’ mode.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.StyleSelector module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.StyleSelector.StyleSelector¶

Bases: Object, ABC

A KML ‘StyleSelector’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#styleselector. The StyleSelector class is the abstract base class for KML Objects that represent display styles for Feature instances.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.SubStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.SubStyle.SubStyle¶

Bases: Object, ABC

A KML ‘SubStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference. Note that there is no description of the SubStyle class in the Google KML documentation. The SubStyle is the abstract base class for the specific sub-styles that are optionally included in Style objects.
